question: Can I afford a mortgage for a $300,000 house with a $50,000 annual salary and $10,000 savings?
true_answer: Yes, based on your salary, savings, and a reasonable DTI, you can afford a $300,000 house.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage for a $300,000 house with a $50,000 annual salary and $10,000 savings?

Plan: 1) Use home_loan_agent to assess affordability criteria. 2) Calculate debt-to-income ratio. 3) Validate credit score with credit_agent. 4) Retrieve supervisor review. 5) Provide comprehensive answer.
Mortgage affordability generally requires a stable income and sufficient savings for down payment.
Calculating maximum loan amount based on income and savings.
Based on income, loan amount of $240,000 is feasible with current interest rates.
Credit score requirement typically starts at 620. Ensure your score meets this.
Do I have enough for the down payment?
Down payment typically 3-20% of the house price. $9,000 minimum for an FHA loan.
Review complete. All financial indicators are positive for loan approval.
Yes, with your income and savings, you can afford the house. Ensure your credit score is above 620.
Remember to maintain a good credit score and manage your DTI effectively.
